Installation¶

Quick Start¶

  1. Install with pip (see pip section)

To use an FPGA and peripherals:

  1. Download FrontPanel from OpalKelly (see FPGA section)

  2. Download Registers.xlsx and add unsupported peripherals (see Peripherals section)

  3. Create config.yaml with interfaces.utils.create_yaml() and edit (see YAML Configuration section)

pip¶

PACKAGE_NAME can be installed using pip.

pip install PACKAGE_NAME

FPGA¶

To use the FPGA class with an Opal Kelly FrontPanel-supported device, you will also need to download the FrontPanel SDK from Opal Kelly. You will also need to update the config.yaml file. See the YAML Configuration section and example.

Peripherals¶

To use peripherals, you will need FrontPanel (see FPGA section) as well as the Registers.xlsx spreadsheet with register information for all supported peripherals, available on the GitHub. Update the config.yaml file with the path to Registers.xlsx (see YAML Configuration section). If you are using a peripheral not currently supported by PACKAGE_NAME, see the New Peripheral Guide.

YAML Configuration¶

PACKAGE_NAME uses a config.yaml file to customize paths to needed files and other user-configurable options. To start, install the package (see pip section), and open a Python shell. You can then import interfaces.utils.create_yaml() and run it like below.

>>> from interfaces.utils import create_yaml
>>> create_yaml()
YAML created at C:/Users/username/.PACKAGE_NAME

From there, you can configure the options available by editing the config.yaml file created at the path given after running interfaces.utils.create_yaml(). An example YAML is shown below.

endpoint_max_width: 32
ep_defines_path: C:/Users/username/my_project/ep_defines.v
fpga_bitfile_path: C:/Users/username/my_project/top_level_module.bit
frontpanel_path: C:/Program Files/Opal Kelly/FrontPanelUSB
registers_path: C:/Users/username/my_project/Registers.xlsx
